title.value: Technology-enhanced trauma training in low-resource settings: A scoping review and feasibility analysis of educational technologies
title.justification: This is the main title provided for the research paper.
title.quote: Technology-enhanced trauma training in low-resource settings: A scoping review and feasibility analysis of educational technologies

extractions.description: This study reviews current technologies used in trauma courses and evaluates their feasibility for low- and lower-middle-income countries (LMICs), focusing on technology-enhanced trauma training.

type.justification: The paper involves a scoping review and feasibility analysis, which involves collecting and analyzing data to draw conclusions on the feasibility of educational technologies for trauma training in LMICs.
type.quote: Methods: We conducted a scoping review evaluating the learning outcomes of technology-enhanced training... Based on the Technology-Enhanced Learning criteria, we created and applied a feasibility analysis tool to evaluate the technologies for use in LMICs.

name.justification: The primary focus of the study is on trauma training which falls under the umbrella of medical education.
name.quote: Educational technologies present a unique opportu- nity to enhance the quality of trauma training.

name.justification: The paper discusses various forms of simulation training, such as high-fidelity mannequins and virtual simulations, as part of technology-enhanced learning.
name.quote: The most common technologies were high-fidelity mannequins (60%), video-assisted debriefing (19%), and low-fidelity mannequins (13%).

name.justification: Virtual simulation is highlighted as one of the technologies with the best feasibility scores.
name.quote: Virtual simulation and digital courses had the best feasibility scores, but still represented a minority of articles in our review.
